column4: whats the deal with Ubuntu/Linux support with videos............
and why the hell does firefox always open totem to play videos
I use mplayer for playing vids in firefox. perhaps you could try that?
how would i tell firefox to use mplayer?
i've got mplayer and vlc, still uses totem
have you restarted firefox in-between these attempts?
I can't see that video you linked to either
yes they do. the codecs are proprietary.
it could be illegal depending on which country you live in.
microsoft pays licensing fees in order to have mp3 support included in windows.
